channel.title: NDTV News Search Records Found 1000
channel.description: NDTV.com provides the latest information from and in-depth coverage of India and the world. Find breaking news, India news, top stories, elections, politics, business, cricket, movies, lifestyle, health, live TV, videos, photos and more.

item.title: Indian Students In Iran Being Moved To Safer Places As Conflict Deepens

media:content.media:description: Israel launched "Operation Rising Lion" with a surprise attack on Iran on Friday morning.

item.description: Indian students in Iran being moved to safer places within the country, says New Delhi as Middle East conflict intensifies
item.content:encoded: Indian students in Iran being moved to safer places within the country, says New Delhi as Middle East conflict intensifies

item.title: Israel, Iran Continue To Trade Missile Attacks, Sirens Heard In Jerusalem

media:content.media:description: A huge fire was seen in the city of Haifa after Iran's strikes.

item.description: Israeli skies were streaked with a barrage of Iranian missiles yet again on Sunday amid a spiralling conflict between the two nations.
item.content:encoded: <iframe title="Player" class="head-story__img img__full lazyload" height="300" scrolling=no frameborder=no src="about:blank" data-src="https://www.ndtv.com/video/embed-player/id/953090/play-via-app-wap?pWidth=100&pHeight=100&embed_type=story&site=classic&autostart=1"> </iframe>Israeli skies were streaked with a barrage of Iranian missiles yet again on Sunday amid a spiralling conflict between the two nations.

item.title: Israel-Iran Attack LIVE: Sirens, Booms Heard In Jerusalem, Air Defence Activated In Tehran

media:content.media:description: Israeli air defence systems intercept Iranian missiles over Tel Aviv

item.description: Israel-Iran Attack Live: Israel and Iran exchanged attacks for the third day, with the Israeli military saying it conducted an "extensive series of strikes" on the headquarters of the Iranian Defence Ministry and the SPND nuclear project.
item.content:encoded: Israel-Iran Attack Live: Israel and Iran exchanged attacks for the third day, with the Israeli military saying it conducted an "extensive series of strikes" on the headquarters of the Iranian Defence Ministry and the SPND nuclear project.

item.title: Trump Vetoed Israeli Plan To Kill Iran's Supreme Leader: US Officials
item.description: President Donald Trump vetoed an Israeli plan in recent days to kill the Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, two US officials said.
item.content:encoded: President Donald Trump vetoed an Israeli plan in recent days to kill the Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, two US officials said.

item.title: "Iran, Israel Should Make Deal Just Like I Got India, Pak To Make One": Trump
item.description: US President Donald Trump claimed that he could secure a deal between Iran and Israel just as he had done between India and Pakistan last month by "using trade".
item.content:encoded: US President Donald Trump claimed that he could secure a deal between Iran and Israel just as he had done between India and Pakistan last month by "using trade".

item.title: Protesters Against Overtourism Take To Streets Of Southern Europe

media:content.media:description: Locals fired water pistols at shop windows and set off smoke in Barcelona.

item.description: Thousands of people took to the streets of cities in southern Europe on Sunday to demonstrate against overtourism, firing water pistols at shop windows and setting off smoke in Barcelona, where the main protest took place.
item.content:encoded: Thousands of people took to the streets of cities in southern Europe on Sunday to demonstrate against overtourism, firing water pistols at shop windows and setting off smoke in Barcelona, where the main protest took place.

item.title: Crypto, Golf, Watches, Perfumes: How Trump Earned Over $600 Million in 2024

media:content.media:description: Trump has taken significant steps to clear regulatory hurdles for the crypto industry.

item.description: Donald Trump pocketed more than $57 million from token sales by the crypto venture he and his sons helped launch last year, according to federal financial disclosure forms.
item.content:encoded: Donald Trump pocketed more than $57 million from token sales by the crypto venture he and his sons helped launch last year, according to federal financial disclosure forms.

item.title: Trump Administration Weighs Adding 36 Countries To Travel Ban, Memo Says

media:content.media:description: The directive was part of an immigration crackdown Trump launched this year. (File)

item.description: US President Donald Trump's administration is considering significantly expanding its travel ban by potentially banning citizens of 36 additional countries from entering the United States, according to an internal State Department cable.
item.content:encoded: US President Donald Trump's administration is considering significantly expanding its travel ban by potentially banning citizens of 36 additional countries from entering the United States, according to an internal State Department cable.

item.title: Russian Air Attack Damaged Boeing Offices In Ukraine: Report

media:content.media:description: Russia launched air attacks on Kyiv last week, using 315 drones and seven missiles. (File)

item.description: A building used by Boeing in Kyiv was badly damaged in a recent large-scale Russian air attack, the Financial Times reported, citing six people familiar with the matter.
item.content:encoded: A building used by Boeing in Kyiv was badly damaged in a recent large-scale Russian air attack, the Financial Times reported, citing six people familiar with the matter.

item.title: India Issues Fresh Advisory For Nationals In Israel Amid Iranian Strikes

media:content.media:description: US President Donald Trump on Sunday urged Iran and Israel to "make a deal".

item.description: India on Sunday issued a fresh advisory for nationals in Israel as tensions in the Middle East continued to rise.
item.content:encoded: India on Sunday issued a fresh advisory for nationals in Israel as tensions in the Middle East continued to rise.

item.title: Nearly 7,000 UK University Students Caught Cheating Using AI: Report

media:content.media:description: The growing reliance on AI tools is proving to be a major challenge for education institutions

item.description: Nearly 7,000 university students in the UK were caught cheating using ChatGPT and other artificial intelligence tools during the 2023-24 academic year, according to data obtained by The Guardian.
item.content:encoded: Nearly 7,000 university students in the UK were caught cheating using ChatGPT and other artificial intelligence tools during the 2023-24 academic year, according to data obtained by The Guardian.

item.title: Video: How Israeli Forces Intercepted 20 Iranian Drones In An Hour

media:content.media:description: Israel said it intercepted approximately 20 drones in an hour.

item.description: Israeli air and naval forces intercepted at least 20 drones launched from Iran in an hour on Sunday, according to the Israel Defence Forces (IDF).
item.content:encoded: Israeli air and naval forces intercepted at least 20 drones launched from Iran in an hour on Sunday, according to the Israel Defence Forces (IDF).

item.title: Israel, Iran Bombard Each Other: What To Know Of Conflict

media:content.media:description: Iran also struck sites used by Israeli warplanes for refuelling.

item.description: Israel and Iran traded fire for a third straight day on Sunday, with rising casualties and expanding targets marking a sharp escalation in the conflict between the longtime adversaries.
item.content:encoded: Israel and Iran traded fire for a third straight day on Sunday, with rising casualties and expanding targets marking a sharp escalation in the conflict between the longtime adversaries.

item.title: US-China Trade Talks Leave Military-Use Rare Earth Issue Unsettled: Sources

media:content.media:description: American and Chinese negotiators reached a deal in London on Wednesday.

item.description: Beijing has not committed to grant export clearance for some specialised rare-earth magnets that US military suppliers need for fighter jets and missile systems.
item.content:encoded: Beijing has not committed to grant export clearance for some specialised rare-earth magnets that US military suppliers need for fighter jets and missile systems.

item.title: Russia Says It Struck Oil Refinery That Supplies Fuel To Ukrainian Army

media:content.media:description: There was no immediate Ukrainian comment on the Russian statement.(Representational)

item.description: Russian forces carried out an overnight strike on the Kremenchuk oil refinery that supplies fuel to Ukrainian forces in the Donbas region, Russia's defence ministry said.
item.content:encoded: Russian forces carried out an overnight strike on the Kremenchuk oil refinery that supplies fuel to Ukrainian forces in the Donbas region, Russia's defence ministry said.

item.title: Cyprus Says Iran Asked Them To Convey 'Some Messages' To Israel

media:content.media:description: President Nikos Christodoulides said he was not happy with EU's slow reaction to Middle East crisis.

item.description: Iran has asked Cyprus to convey "some messages" to Israel, President Nikos Christodoulides said on Sunday, adding he expected to speak to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu later in the day.
item.content:encoded: Iran has asked Cyprus to convey "some messages" to Israel, President Nikos Christodoulides said on Sunday, adding he expected to speak to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu later in the day.

item.title: "Everything Was Destroyed": Israelis Grapple With Damage From Iran Strike

media:content.media:description: Teams from the Home Front Command have been working to rescue people trapped in the rubble.

item.description: In Israel's north, four people were killed earlier when a strike hit the town of Tamra, taking to 13 the death count in the country since the fighting with Iran began on Friday.
item.content:encoded: In Israel's north, four people were killed earlier when a strike hit the town of Tamra, taking to 13 the death count in the country since the fighting with Iran began on Friday.

item.title: Minnesota Lawmaker Killing: US Police Find "Hit List" In Suspect's Car

media:content.media:description: Melissa Hortman was killed on Saturday hours after she voted for a Republican bill.

item.description: The shooter who killed Minnesota Representative Melissa Hortman and her husband, left behind a manifesto targeting pro-choice Democratic lawmakers.
item.content:encoded: The shooter who killed Minnesota Representative Melissa Hortman and her husband, left behind a manifesto targeting pro-choice Democratic lawmakers.
